alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 25 at 1:40PM PST until December 28 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM TUESDAY TO 3 PM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, abnormally high tide around 7.0 feet. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves up to 7 feet Wednesday building to 10 to 14 feet Thursday with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Tuesday morning. For the High Surf Advisory, from 9 PM Tuesday to 3 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. Pooling of sea water is possible around high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. Enhanced beach erosion is also possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Astronomical high tide around 7.0 feet is expected Tuesday morning around 800 AM. Large surf is expected to continue Thursday night through at least Saturday. The large surf combined with relatively high tides of 6.2 to 6.6 feet may result in more significant coastal flooding and beach erosion. This could require the issuance of a coastal flood advisory as we draw closer to the event.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
